document.masterDocTitle: A review of the South American species of Heilus Kuschel, 1955 (Curculionidae Molytinae: Molytini: Hylobiina) with emphasis on those from Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Non-Type material: The images of non-type specimens of
Heilus ochrifer ( Boheman, 1843 )
( Fig. 11 ) deposited at NHRS, Stockholm , Pascoe Collection were examined bearing the following labels: “Rio janeiro Wofhing; ochrifer Boh. ;
Heilus ochrifer (Boh.) Kuschel
det. 1960; NHRS-TOBI 000003227; 4636 E91; Baccifer. Fihh.n..p. 147-148”.

Redescription. Length (pronotum + elytra) of males and females 9.7 to 11.4/ 9.6 to 10.6 mm , respectively. Integument black, not very bright. Rostrum as long as pronotum. Thorax. Pronotum ( Figs. 11 A–B) about 1.2 times wider than long, with rounded granules on pronotal disc; with yellowish and very short setae distributed over pronotum. Elytra ( Figs. 11 A–B) about 1.3 times longer than wide, rounded granules distributed from base to apical callus, smaller granules in apical region; yellowish and very short setae in basal and apical thirds of elytra, transverse band of yellowish or reddish brown scales distributed from middle of elytra to apical callus. Male genitalia . Median lobe of aedeagus ( Fig. 18I ) with rectangular apex, with elongate setae confined in center; aedeagal apodemes about 2.2 times longer than median lobe. Internal sac with tiny spicules and armed with trilobate sclerite ( Fig. 19H ). Tegmen ( Fig. 20H ). Manubrium about 1.9 times longer than dorsal lobes. Female genitalia ( Fig. 21H ). Coxites elongate, with short setae at apex; styli cylindrical, with dense and elongate setae at apex. Spermathecal duct very short inserted into posterior margin of bursa copulatrix. Spermathecal capsule ( Fig. 22H ) curved, collum elongate with roughness on inner margin, ramus non-prominent, cornu rounded at apex; spermathecal gland elongate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Heilus ochrifer
, undetermined sex. A. dorsal view. B. lateral view. C. labels. The copyright of images belongs to NHRS.

1♂ , J.F. Zikan ( FIOC )
.

Geographical distribution .
This species occurs in Brazil ( Wibmer & O’Brien 1986 ) and here this distribution is expanded to the states of Rio de Janeiro , São Paulo , and Santa Catarina ( Fig. 23I )
.

Associated plants. Bondar (1943) recorded
H. ochrifer
attacks on seeds Annonacea in Bahia state .

Remarks.
Heilus ochrifer
differs from the other species mainly in the transverse band of yellowish scales and larger and rounded granules uniformly distributed on the elytra.
